Title: Show that $ e^{A+B}=e^A e^B$
Content: If $A$ and $B$ are $n\times n$ matrices such that $AB = BA$ (that is, $A$ and $B$ commute), show that $$ e^{A+B}=e^A e^B$$ Note that $A$ and $B$ do NOT have to be diagonalizable.
AcceptedAnswer:
$$\begin{align*}e^{A}e^{B} &= \left(\sum \frac{A^{n}}{n!}\right)\left(\sum\frac{B^{n}}{n!}\right)\\
        		&=\sum^{\infty}_{m=0}\sum^{\infty}_{n=0}\frac{A^{m}B^{n}}{m!n!}\\
        		&=\sum^{\infty}_{l=0}\sum^{l}_{m=0}\frac{A^{m}B^{l-m}}{m!(l-m)!}\\
        		&=\sum^{\infty}_{l=0}\frac{1}{l!}\sum^{l}_{m=0}\frac{l!}{m!(l-m)!}A^{m}B^{l-m}\\
        		&=\sum^{\infty}_{l=0}\frac{(A+B)^{l}}{l!}\\
        		&= e^{A+B}\end{align*}$$ Note:A and B have to commute.
Also, I set l=m+n.  I did this because we want to use the binomial theorem to simplify this.
